session_summary: Jolene and Deborah caught up at 4:50 pm on 25 February 2023. Jolene shared how balancing engineering school with her partner's video games is challenging but she finds peace through yoga and meditation. Her partner sometimes joins in, bringing them closer. They've been together for three years since meeting in an engineering class, and their relationship started from a strong friendship. Deborah praised Jolene's progress and encouraged her to continue prioritizing self-care. Deborah, on the other hand, mentioned her morning routine of meditation, yoga, teaching classes, and now a morning jog for self-connection. She highlighted the importance of self-care to help others and emphasized the value of prioritizing oneself. Jolene appreciated Deborah's support and vowed to continue prioritizing self-care.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Hi Deborah, it's been a while! Since we last talked, so much has happened. Balancing engineering school with my partner's video games is quite a feat. But I'm also setting aside time for myself, doing yoga and meditation. It helps give me calm amidst the craziness.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Hey Jolene! Great to hear from you. Taking a break is key. How have those practices been helping with everything?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a woman sitting on a yoga mat doing a yoga pose
conversation_turns.text: They seriously saved me. I chill out and gain perspective when I do yoga. Afterward, I'm more alert and motivated. Here is my last photo.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Wow, cool that yoga has been helping you out! Do they also do yoga with you? Does your partner do yoga with you?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a man and a woman holding hands with rings on them
conversation_turns.text: He started joining me sometimes, which is nice for bonding and relaxing. It's brought us closer. This is just our random photo.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Aw, that's wonderful! How long have you been married?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: We're not married yet but we've been together for three years. We're taking it slow and loving the ride. This ring on his hand is just a decoration, not a wedding ring.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Sounds nice, Jolene. Enjoying the journey is the main thing. So, how did you two meet?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a book and a calculator on a table
conversation_turns.text: We actually met in an engineering class in college and quickly became friends. It eventually blossomed into something more and it's been great!

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Wow, your relationship started from a strong friendship. Do you still enjoy working on engineering projects together?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a group of men standing in front of a building
conversation_turns.text: Yep, teaming up for these projects feels great! We get each other's struggles and both love it.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Have yoga or meditation helped with any stress?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Whenever I'm overwhelmed, I just take a break and do some breathing or meditate. It really helps me feel calmer and clearer, so I'm able to handle challenges more easily.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: It's been great to see your progress since we last chatted - keep it up!

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Thanks, Deb! Your support really means a lot. I'm gonna keep pushing forward and continue taking time for myself.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a person sitting on a bench looking at the sunset
conversation_turns.text: Always rooting for you. Remember to listen to your heart and take good care. Here's a photo I took while reflecting outdoors. It's a reminder to find peace even in chaos.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: I'm curious, what does your daily routine look like?

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: In the morning, I meditate, do yoga, and teach classes. And yesterday I went for a morning jog for the first time in a nearby park. I will now incorporate this into my daily routine. And in the evenings, I spend time with loved ones.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Why did you decide that?

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Exercise is key for me - it makes me feel connected to my body.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: This is a great healthy habit!

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: It's like they say - "Can't pour from an empty cup." Looking out for ourselves gives us the energy to help others. And don't forget, you're worth it too!

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Thanks, Deb. Your words really mean something to me. I'll keep remembering to prioritize self-care.

Deborah: Deborah goes for a morning jog in the nearby park and decides to integrate it into her daily routine.
Jolene: Jolene starts doing yoga and meditation, sometimes joined by her partner, to clear her head while striking a balance with her studies.
Jolene is studying engineering in school while balancing her partner's video games.
Jolene practices yoga and meditation to stay calm amidst the busyness of life.
Jolene's partner sometimes joins her in doing yoga for bonding and relaxation.
Jolene has been with her partner for three years but they are not married yet.
Jolene and her partner met in an engineering class in college and their romantic relationship grew from a friendship.
Jolene finds teaming up with her partner on engineering projects enjoyable.
Yoga and meditation help Jolene feel calmer and clearer when overwhelmed, enabling her to tackle challenges more easily.
Deborah: Deborah meditates, does yoga, and teaches classes in the morning.
Deborah went for a morning jog in a nearby park for the first time and plans to include it in her daily routine.
Deborah values exercise as it makes her feel connected to her body.
